item.title: Estonian Tech Veterans Want to Strengthen European Civil Defense
item.description: Startup founder and investor Sten Tamkivi views defense as an all-of-society effort that includes civilian and military networks working in tandem.
item.dc:creator: Steven Rosenbush

item.title: In the Hills of Australia, Pacific Allies Are Training to Fight China
item.description: Multinational maneuvers are the new normal as the U.S. and its allies prepare for a possible confrontation with China over Taiwan.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Trump Signals Support for New Israel Attack if Iran Moves Toward Bomb
item.description: Trump is counting on the threat of more attacks to pressure Tehran into a nuclear agreement, but Israel is skeptical a pact would prevent Iran from moving toward a nuclear weapon.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Opinion | Trump Isn’t Rebuilding the U.S. Military
item.description: The President’s 2026 budget, like Biden’s, is an after-inflation cut in defense.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | ‘Tariff Man’ Strikes Again—at Canada
item.description: Trump announces a 35% tax on America’s No. 2 trading partner.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Russia Intensifies Its Drone War
item.description: It launched 332 of them against Ukraine in June 2024. The nightly number can now be double that.
item.dc:creator: Jillian Kay Melchior

item.title: Opinion | How the U.K.’s Sickness Benefits Trap Britons
item.description: If middle-class workers were offered significantly more money for signing off sick with depression or anxiety, how many would persist with their not-always interesting jobs?

item.title: Opinion | Israel Goes to War, and Dancing Breaks Out
item.description: When I visited Jerusalem, I didn’t expect to spend half my time in a bomb shelter. It was joyous.
item.dc:creator: Alvin H. Rosenfeld

item.title: Rubio’s 36-Hour Trip to Asia Left U.S. Allies Wanting More
item.description: Marco Rubio’s first trip to Asia as secretary of state was aimed at assuring U.S. partners. Instead, it was cut short and dominated by trade tensions.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Israel’s Military Lawyers Raise Concerns About New Plan to Move Hundreds of Thousands of Gazans
item.description: The legal branch of the Israeli military and leading lawyers are raising concerns about an Israeli military proposal to screen Palestinians and move them into a secure area around the city of Rafah in the Gaza Strip.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Nintendo’s Use of a Rare-Earth Magnet for the Switch 2 Could Expose It to China’s Whims
item.description: Nintendo’s Switch 2 videogame machine uses a rare-earth magnet to attach its hand-held controllers to the main console, according to a teardown.
item.dc:creator: Yang Jie

item.title: Trump Threatens 35% Tariff on Some Canadian Goods
item.description: The new tariffs would exempt, for now, goods compliant with the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: Hunting Down Russian Spies With Norway’s Intelligence Service
item.description: A small town in the Arctic has become a hub for suspicious activity following Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.
item.dc:creator: Eve Hartley

item.title: Taiwan Resists China With Military Displays and History Lessons
item.description: Amped-up drills and new U.S. tanks have added bite to President Lai Ching-te’s Taiwan-is-a-country lecture tour.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: Opinion | Trump’s Tariffs Blow Up the Copper Market
item.description: U.S. firms will pay 50% more while waiting years for more U.S. production.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: U.K. and France Strike Deal Over Migrant Boats Crossing Channel
item.description: As part of the deal, the U.K. would return migrants to France in exchange for accepting an equal number already in France who have a stronger connection to the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Rubio Cites New Path to Ukraine Peace Talks After Meeting Russia’s Lavrov
item.description: The discussion in Malaysia follows Trump’s harsh criticism of Putin and pledge to resume military aid to Kyiv.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Two Ships Desperately Tried to Fight Off Houthi Attacks. Help Never Arrived.
item.description: The commercial ships tried to fight off the attacks, the group’s most complex and violent yet, for more than 48 hours.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Trump’s Tariff Assault on Brazil Thrills Bolsonaro’s Supporters
item.description: Former president shot to prominence in 2018 amid a wave of dissatisfaction with corruption and crime.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: The Fault Lines in the Autocratic Axis
item.description: Russia, China, Iran and North Korea are all hostile to the U.S. That doesn’t mean they would go to war for one another—for now.
item.dc:creator: Yaroslav Trofimov

item.title: The Drone Factories Fueling Russia’s Unprecedented Assaults on Ukraine
item.description: The latest assault included more drones in a single night than Russia used in the entire month of July last year.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Tariff Anxiety Spreading Across Japan, BOJ Report Shows
item.description: Anxiety over U.S. tariffs has been spreading across Japan, a central bank report shows, sending a worrying signal about the corporate outlook as trade uncertainty deepens.
item.dc:creator: Megumi Fujikawa

item.title: Brazil Won’t Take Orders From Trump, President Says
item.description: Relations between the U.S. and Brazil deteriorated after President Trump sought to halt criminal proceedings against his right-wing ally in the country, former leader Jair Bolsonaro, by imposing steep tariffs on Latin America’s biggest nation.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Israel’s Agonizing Choice Over Which Hostages to Save
item.description: A deal being hammered out with Hamas would see 10 men released out of 20 believed to be alive, and the decision about who should be freed is creating deep despair.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Trump to Impose 50% Brazil Tariff, Citing Bolsonaro Trial
item.description: The levy is the highest announced so far in Trump’s letters to world leaders this week, and comes after he wrote a lengthy message supporting the former Brazilian leader.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: One Way to Win Trump Over: Nominate Him for the Nobel Prize
item.description: African leaders told the president during a meeting at the White House that he should win the prestigious award.
item.dc:creator: Annie Linskey

item.title: France, U.K. Suggest Nuclear Protection Could Extend to European Allies
item.description: The move appears to offer both countries’ nuclear weapons as a deterrent for all of Europe at a time when allies are nervous about the U.S. commitment to the continent’s security.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: BOE Will Reflect on Steeper Curve in Quantitative Tightening Review, Bailey Says
item.description: The BOE will take account of the rise in yields on longer maturity government bonds as it considers how far to reduce its portfolio of gilts over the coming year.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Six North Koreans Sent Back on a Tiny Wooden Boat by the South
item.description: The fishermen said they wanted to go home, but repatriations pose legal and moral questions given the Kim regime’s secrecy.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Putin’s Strategy of Paying Lip Service to Peace Falters as Trump Loses Patience
item.description: The president’s remarks during a cabinet meeting were the latest sign of his growing displeasure with the Russian leader.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Africa Wants Its Critical Minerals to Yield Jobs, Not Just Dollars
item.description: The Trump administration wants to cut deals to secure more of the key materials, but African countries are imposing export restrictions to help develop their own industries.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: White House Weighs Giving Ukraine Another Patriot Air-Defense System
item.description: The move would mark the first time Trump has approved providing a major weapons system to Kyiv beyond the number authorized by the Biden White House.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: A Syrian Death Factory Gives Up Its Secrets
item.description: Under the Assad regime, Saydnaya prison became a mass-killing machine; ‘a symbol of shame for the whole world.’
item.dc:creator: Belle Cushing

item.title: EU Closes In on U.S. Trade Deal, Testing Bloc’s Unity
item.description: Terms of a potential agreement could benefit some European countries more than others, sparking divisions.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Deaths of Five Israeli Soldiers Fuel Debate Over Ending Gaza War
item.description: A majority of Israelis want an end to the fighting, while right-wing members of the government prefer to keep going, saying Hamas remains undefeated.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: U.S.’s Biggest Asian Allies Ready Last-Ditch Trade Appeal to Trump
item.description: President Trump’s latest salvo on trade gives U.S. allies three weeks to persuade Washington to relax tariffs that would be costly for their export-dependent economies.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: Trump to Resume Sending Weapons to Ukraine
item.description: The U.S. will send additional defensive arms because Moscow is hitting Kyiv “very hard,” the president said.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Trump and Netanyahu Meet as New Middle East Tests Loom
item.description: A region that was awash in conflict and risk turns toward dealmaking—but for how long?
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: How Old-School Tech Is Rewiring Drone Warfare in Ukraine
item.description: Kyiv is trying to blunt Russia’s grinding advance with a new generation of quadcopters steered by long coils of ultrathin and highly versatile wire.
item.dc:creator: Svet Jacqueline

item.title: Canada’s Finance Minister Asks Cabinet Colleagues to Identify Spending Cuts
item.description: François-Philippe Champagne calls for spending cuts of 7.5% to finance tax breaks and higher defense budget.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Russian Minister Found Dead Hours After Being Fired by Putin
item.description: Authorities called the death of Roman Starovoyt a suspected suicide.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Elon Musk Is Running Out of Road in China
item.description: As Tesla falls behind the local competitors it helped create, the billionaire’s rupture with Trump is limiting his value to Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Yoko Kubota

item.title: Congo Braces for HIV Surge After U.S. Funding Stops
item.description: U.S. funded treatments in the country have helped reduce deaths from HIV/AIDS to around 14,000 a year, from as high as 200,000.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: The Warning Signs for Russia’s Economy Are Flashing Red
item.description: A slowdown exposes the limits of the country’s wartime economy and suggests sanctions may finally be taking a toll.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Xi Has Spent Decades Preparing for a Cold War With the U.S.
item.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping is entering trade negotiations with a grand strategy inspired by his understanding of what the Soviet Union got wrong.
item.dc:creator: Lingling Wei

item.title: China Warns India to Choose Its Words Carefully on Dalai Lama and Tibet
item.description: The exchange highlighted how the process of identifying the next Dalai Lama could add fresh tensions to relations between the two countries.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: China Accelerating Implementation of U.S. Trade Framework, Commerce Ministry Says
item.description: China is reviewing and approving applications for exports of controlled items to the U.S., as Beijing and Washington speed up the implementation of their trade framework, the Chinese Commerce Ministry said.

item.title: Trump Says He Is ‘Very Disappointed’ With Putin Conversation on Ukraine
item.description: He spoke to the Russian president about the war in Ukraine but made no headway on halting the fighting.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: Britain’s Welfare Reversal Hammers U.K. Bonds as Chancellor Tears Up
item.description: Investors fret more taxes or borrowing are likely after the U.K. government abandoned a plan to cut welfare spending.
item.dc:creator: Joe Wallace

item.title: Britain’s Royals Give Up Their Luxury Train in the Name of Fiscal Restraint
item.description: Despite receiving a near-record boost in funding, the royal family has decided it is the end of the line for its locomotive service.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: ‘Death to the IDF’ Chant at Glastonbury Music Festival Sparks Uproar
item.description: The BBC apologized as British Prime Minister Keir Starmer criticized the state broadcaster for airing a punk duo live. The group’s visa to tour the U.S. was canceled.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: China’s Communist Party Now Has 100 Million Members. Many Are in It for the Paycheck.
item.description: In a sluggish economy, membership is seen as a path to a stable state-sector income.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: The Coup Leader Who’s Become an Anti-Western Hero in Africa and Beyond
item.description: Ibrahim Traoré, Burkina Faso’s leader, counts admirers from Nairobi to Jamaica and London. Russia is also courting him.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: China Steals Language and Home Life From Tibetan Kids as Young as 4
item.description: Beijing is building a broad network of preschools across Tibetan areas, seeking to inculcate loyalty to the Chinese Communist Party early in life.
item.dc:creator: Niharika Mandhana

item.title: Congo and Rwanda Sign a Peace Accord in Washington
item.description: The deal opens critical mineral deposits to U.S. investment.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: U.K. Pay Growth Has Some Way to Go Before It Normalizes, Says BOE’s Bailey
item.description: U.K. businesses are trimming jobs and pay in response to higher employment taxes, the head of the Bank of England said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: China Is Still Choking Exports of Rare Earths Despite Pact With U.S.
item.description: Western companies are struggling to secure approvals for rare-earth imports from Chinese authorities, despite the U.S.-China deal.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: Oil Workers, Snagged in a Dispute Over a Dictator’s Son’s Yacht, Are Freed After Two Years
item.description: Equatorial Guinea’s President Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo freed two South African oilmen who were imprisoned in apparent retaliation for the seizing in Cape Town of assets of the president’s son.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: Air India Crash Investigators Recover Black Boxes as Death Toll Hits 265
item.description: An early focus of the probe includes a possible loss or reduction of thrust.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tangel

item.title: The Man in Seat 11A Who Walked Away From the Air India Crash
item.description: Britain’s Viswashkumar Ramesh said he doesn’t know why he survived, while more than 200 others, including his brother, died. In India, he has become known as the miracle of window seat 11A.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Air India Boeing Crash Kills Hundreds, Leaves Sole Survivor
item.description: The Boeing jet carrying 242 people crashed in a residential area shortly after takeoff. Only one person survived the crash, the first fatal incident for Boeing’s Dreamliner aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: India, Pakistan Cease-Fire Brokered by U.S. Appears to Hold
item.description: The neighbors had agreed to a full and immediate cease-fire in the worst violence between them for more than two decades.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
